the author writes of feeling “heady and faint just for being there [in Beijing]: the capital of the next century’s Superpower, the center of the world for a day, its youth, Borg-like in their unified loathing of our flag and our little plot.” (This last word refers to the fact that there was a widespread assumption in China then, as there still is, that the bombing of the Belgrade embassy had been intentional, not a mistake.)
